title: Manchester City's Georgia Stanway counting her blessings as she prepares for biggest WSL game of season so far
text:
Every so often, when Georgia Stanway was working hard in the gym to recover from her hamstring injury, from inside she would hear the sounds of her Manchester City teammates on the pitch. The young ball of energy would look out at them and feel a pang of jealousy. She thought of all the hard work she put in to build herself up for September after the World Cup - wasted. All for an injury she picked up in only the second game of the season.

At just 20 years old, this five weeks out of touch with the group has felt long for the England forward. “It is difficult,” says Stanway. “Especially when you’re in the gym and the girls are on the pitch and you can hear them getting excited for game day, getting all pumped. I think that’s one of the hardest things to kind of sink in.

“Everything you’ve worked for and the efforts that you’ve put in are kind of taken away from you. You kind of feel like, you’re kind of out of it. It’s kind of you’re getting removed from an environment that you love the most and I think that’s the hardest thing for me.”
description: Every so often, when Georgia Stanway was working hard in the gym to recover from her hamstring injury, from inside she would hear the sounds of her Manchester City teammates on the pitch.
